het selve voorder konde remitteeren doen seer geirne sal detit van ul
remisie afwaghte & nae vndelijk grootn
In Antwerpen 10 Aprill
Brussel me BoneerayB: vanderklooster
Mons. 8 deser hebbe aen ul het noodigh geschreven desen allen omte accomp
de quitantie van £74:4:- van de wed Bouwens aen haer voor ul rek &
order betaelt het half fen laken is mij wel geworden & op ul rek genotte
soo iets voor valt waer in ul kan dienen gelieft te commandeer
In Antwerp 10 Aprill
Brussel wed. Bonne roy
jff in antwoort aenden ul van gisteren is de canten mij wel geworden sal
eenigh van ul gatte werk tot manchest, moeten wedersend, alsoo die voor mij
uijt de moede sijn t en hebbe wel een stuck verise crawat werck vam
doen alwas vand ƒ10 a 12 pr a hebbe de andere kanden selves gemeten
overmete & soming de lenghde niet bevonden sal de naeste weke ue
In Antwerp: 11 Aprill
gelt besorgen waer mede
Mons Pr meurant
mons. En responce al a vre du 9 courant jay presentala lettre de £100: dep
Laquelle mons Donguers ma dit dexccepterr quandrre vrace me metteray
la parrellie somme serat fort agriable accuise que jesuis fort presse
pour l'argent present touschant les ƒ400: sen ay pas eu aucund
nouelle, si vous avet tirre laditte valeur, on me trouverat bien
pour cela vous pouve bien remettre la mesme valeur, etalors je
la satisferay, sans prend la painie devenir vous mesme si il nefoit
quand vous avec esey la
pas nour faut vre hachpe en la quelle occasion vous nue trouvera
derniere servrcable pis que c'or tient son pris ordrinair, so que vous serve
In Antwerpen 12 Aprill
d'adves
London John Loyd
S. my last to you was on the 22: past. sence non from you this onely to accquang
you that I have been att gant & discoursed the needfull about yd in ordered legaturen
part of which I found raddy, & he hath faithfully promised mee to complent
the parcell next week without any further delay, there wanting onely se a rr
peeces so that my next shall bring you the invoyce of them: I neves saw a
com. so demanded as that, I have been almost with all the makers & not
one that would engage him self to make a parcell, oneles he hadd, or should have
3 monthes time for they have all more to do then, they can performe I have
seen orders from one cockere from London for a fast qvantitie, so that I hope
yd will come in time & give content which is the needfull with kinde
In Antwarp 12 Aprill
London Abram vivian
th
S. my last to you was on the 5: curitt sence no post come, so non of yd
to answer, I hope the packett N.13 with you by this time, & could wish to
have yd order for some more, because wee exspect dayly an english yaght
here which would carrij them over verij safe & quick a gouverno. I have
given you orders to provide s00 white manchester bayen, assorted from
36 st to 45 st, besides have sent you pattarnes of 12 severall cullours,
accordingly to which wee want cloathes of all prijses devided in 3
sorts vil dosins from 3 to 3:6 pence a yd raw, broad northrens long
cloathes from 3„8 to 4 s a 4:4 pence a yd raw, broad, or fine northens
from 4:6 to 5 s a yd raw & each pack to be assorted as the pattarnes
sent as also dozing, northrens & broad cloathes or fine each sort by fitt
self as m. chipping did wel op served, & like you may see by his invoyces
of N.1„2:3 r in case you can gett in wath m sauell tykes
of leeds, itt will be our advantioge for he understandes that trads
very well, ovely you must recommand him to foald his cloathes
some what broader then he is to do, for they myst be foulded
about 17 enckes broad provided m'sijkes would not andertake the
ont iest odee ele totmy lit he hiel aeght taee
N. 29 & give yd orders exact enough: there is one Robert mirfield in leeds
which hath served mee formarly, you may yett him to bud an assortment
of 3 packes vin. 24 single dozins, 1z northens & 12 fine ditto
according to the pattarnes sent & belause you can not very well dene
them vrs patt. yett some others as neade to them as possible, & more
lively if possible, if not I'll send you others whilst promtrim you
could write to him above itt & tell him that they must come to
mee, & if he will do, he can do itt well for I have had of his goods
that proved well, so thatt ill write to him my self, & you may send
him the inclosed, if you thinck fitt butt best off all would be to have
mr. tijkes in writing of this receave yd of 25: past, I shall take
care to give due order att Rotterdam for our bale N.31 butt I exspecte
itt should have come with Bindar, which I understand is to saile
speedly: godd send our bale wel over, for I want northren goods I am
glad you recd the linnen N.13 butt I supose itt is N. 12 for N.13 was
th
att dover butt the 9: curitt I am mighty sensibel of what I apained
to the youryer vanden brock, the lord preserve all mankind of such
senses, he should have been a great foole to hang him self for amistris
where there are aso maniny I exspected to heard fro you & remaine
In Antwarp 12 April l 181
London Will Bindar
S. in answer to yd of als fes & 28 pas. have sence ende avoured to cleare
yd acctt. as well of resting goods, as standing ont debts, and hope to give an
acctt. off all very speedly, whilst I am now remboursed I take not ice you
mis an acctt. of sale for yd securitie shall draw out all I ded for you
consecutively, where by you will finde what I receaved & what I have
disposed off in which I exspect yo. shall finde noerrour & bought alobsing
acctt. yett approve of my endeavours if they had been vendable, & such
ware as wee usually want I could have disposed of yd iaday ortwor
for good goods here is a curitt & good com. my thankes for yd proffers to serve mee
when I shall have sent an acctt. of all, in case then you can provide mee a small
assortment as I shall direct, shall be willing to receave a tryall whilst I remant
In Antwarp12 Aprill
London Pickering & Robinson
Mess. by yd of 28 past perceave that mr. pickering was gon to the north that
day & that he should take speciall care to provide the goods desired, on which
I do depend, & in hopes that this may come in time to finde him there
do send some pattarnes to provide so cloathes more which please to dis pasch
with all speed Itake noticce what you write mee concerning the tykes I do
promise & you that what soever you please to in order from mee you will
have as cheap free from all charges aboard as any other shall beable to procure
without any charges, which the provision incladed are no less then sost iuers
apr one with an other, therefore oneles you can do some good after the rate
I note them, you will never beable to advance up on them I am contended
to do all I can to continew & in large our correspondency, in order where
unto shall provide the mentioned 130 tykes in 2 bales each to cont: 65
peeces, butt shall want att last a months time for I have the people att
worck, to compleat an other assortment which will be dra mext week
& then Ill lett ug such as you desire & endeavour to procure good goods
to content whilst in the meane while I have abale in the presss. 14, which
is to be shipped off a munday next aboard Adriaen block & doth cont. 54 peecas
curious goods, them Ile consigne to you & may serve you whilst I am a
providing the 130 peeces which will be don up to yd order, so shall exspects
